extensionDescription.message: View Source, View Selection, and Edit Text with the external editor

optionsAccessKeyDetail.message: Access key commonly used for the context menu, for the shortcut to open the options page, and for the shortcut to execute the editor directly.

optionsAccessKeyDetail2.message: Choose any key, but it must be a single character.

optionsAccessKeyDetail3.message: In the context menu, press 'key' itself.

optionsAccessKeyDetail4.message: NOTE: accesskey in context menu is not yet implemented in WebExtensions.

optionsAppManifestPathDetail.message: Enter the path of application manifest JSON file.

optionsEditorNameDetail.message: Enter the label of the editor.

optionsEditorNameDetail2.message: Disabled if application manifest path field is not filled, or could not find the host etc.

optionsEditorShortCutDetail.message: To execute the editor without going through the context menu, press 'Ctrl + Shift + key' ('Cmd + Shift + key' on Mac).

optionsEditorShortCutLabel.message: Enable Shortcut Key To Execute The Editor Directly

optionsEnableOnlyEditableDetail.message: Enables only when the content is editable.

optionsEnablePBDetail.message: Enables if checked, disables if not.

optionsForceRemoveDetail.message: Forcibly remove temporary files at the end of Private Browsing or at shut down.

optionsForceRemoveDetail2.message: Recommended to be checked, though depending on the editor, this option may cause problems if it is enabled.

optionsOptionsShortCutDetail.message: To open the options page, press 'Ctrl + Alt + key' ('Cmd + Opt + key' on Mac).

optionsOptionsShortCutLabel.message: Enable Shortcut Key To Open The Options Page
